page.title: 04Cottage Hospital in Skegness
page.content: Skegness Hospital is a small cottage hospital on Dorothy Avenue which was built in 1913.It has seven departments which are physiotherapy, X-ray dept., administration,catering,accident dept,day unit,operating theatre,and Mortuary.Skegness cottage hospital has got 40 nurses,2 porters,10 domestics 6 cooks, 2 physiotherapists.The most usual illness is old age.The treatments usually performed are for Varicose veins and Hernia operations. Most of the equipment they use are plastic disposables, plastic needles, and pre packed bandages.The number of accidents a day in winter are 30,and 120 a day in summer.In one whole year they treat about 19 000.To one ward there are about 15 beds.The most common blood range in Skegness is O positive.
